attributes.action: Call upon Redhat UK Ltd to upgrade RHEL5 to python v 3.0
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Redhat Produce Redhat Enterprise Linux 5 which they describe as "The world's leading open source application platform" 
However it currently ships with python v 2.4.3 which is no longer under development and is even behind the 2.4.4 version released with opensolaris.
Python is regarded as being amongst the foremost modern scripting languages and Redhat's tardy behaviour in upgrading to newer and better versions is causing embarrasment to it's users as well as being a major driver in the current global financial meltdown.

We feel that a timely upgrade to python 3.0 would go a long way to stablising international financial services and generally improving the current position of open source software in the market.

reasons: Commercial endorsement, promotion of any product, service or publication, or statements that amount to adverts
Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
